intro: Argyrolobium candicans, commonly known as the silver globular bush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its legume-like pods and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant features a shrub-like growth habit with silver-green leaves and produces small, yellow flowers. Its unique appearance and adaptability to arid conditions make it a notable species in its native habitat. It is often used in ornamental gardening due to its striking visual appeal.
